Description: Reconstructed sherd, made up of seven joining fragments, of upper part of black-figure painted pottery situla. Lion or panther (one paw visible on flank of victim) mauling goat; beneath the handle a vertical meander of two members: below, lotus flowers and palmettes. Purple on upper part of further hind leg of victim.
Curator's comments: The shape should be dumpy, like Pl. GB 603, 5-6 (GR 1888.2-8.12). For the goat's long penis compare Pl. GB 604, 8 (but the two scenes are not from the same pot as Petrie shows them). For the meander compare Pl. GB 601, 5. Tanis ii, pl. 26. 15. Kinch, Fouilles de Vroulia, pl. 46. 5 (coloured). S. Zervos, Rhodes, Capitale du Dodécanèse, fig. 659 (repeats Kinch). In NA-Analysis carried out in 2003 by Prof. H. Mommsen (Helmholtz-Institut, Bonn) the piece fell into one chemical group with other situale (BM GR 1888,0208.65, 1888,0208.16b+17) and with the stamnoi BM GR 1888,0208.42a, 1888,0208.44a and the amphora BM GR 1888,0208.25.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B106.11)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 603, 2) (Group C16)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxvi, 15)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 256)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (Table 1)
